clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of a Power Training Session on Blood Pressure in Elderly Hypertensive Participants
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of a Power Training Session on Blood Pressure in Elderly Hypertensive Participants: a Randomized Crossover Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

collaborator.agency: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul

clinical_study.source: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized cross-over trial to evaluate the cardiovascular responses after a power training session in elderly hypertensive participants. The current hypotesis is that power training session will reduce ambulatory blood pressure in elderly hypertensives when compared to an usual day without exercise (control session).

detailed_description.textblock:
Although resistance exercise (RE) is widely recommended as a non-pharmacological therapy to reduce blood pressure (BP), the efficacy of the RE to lower BP remains controversial. Additionally, the effects of a power training session (PT) on BP remain unclear particularly in elderly patients with hypertension. The objective of the present study is determine the effects of a power training session (PT) on ambulatory BP in elderly patients. All participants will perform two sessions in random order: PT and Control session. Before the experimental sessions the participants will perform maximal strength tests (1 Maximum Repetition test - 1RM) to determine the training loads in which the PT will be performed. The PT will be composed by 3 sets of 8-10 repetitions in 5 exercises (i.e., knee flexion, knee extension, leg press, bench press and upright row) at 50%1RM. The concentric phase during each repetition will be performed "as fast as possible", while the eccentric phase of the movement last approximately 1 to 2 seconds duration.
The control session will be performed in seated rest. Both experimental sessions last 40 min. Before and after experimental sessions reactive hyperemia (assessed by ultrassonography) and BP (assessed by an automatic device) will be assessed throughout one hour. After that, 24h ambulatory blood pressure monitoring will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after control and power training exercise session
primary_outcome.description: Mean 24-h, day-time, night-time of blood pressure in mmHg will be assessed after each experimental session (power training session and control session)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 60 minutes after control and power training exercise session
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure in mmHg will be measured using automatic oscillometric before and after each experimental session throughout one hour

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 60 minutes after control and power training exercise session
secondary_outcome.description: Diastolic blood pressure in mmHg will be measured using automatic oscillometric before and after each experimental session throughout one hour

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 60 minutes after control and power training exercise session
secondary_outcome.description: Flow-mediated dilatation (FMD) assessed through high resolution ultrasonography before and after each experimental session throughout one hour

arm_group.description: Control session without any exercise. The participants remain in seated rest throughout 40 min

The power training session will last 40 min, in which the participants will perform a resistance exercise session using high velocity contractions during the exercises characterizing a power training session

intervention.description: 3 sets of 8-10 repetitions at an intensity corresponding to 50%1RM in 5 exercises (bench press, upright row, leg press, knee extension and knee flexion). The concentric phase of each repetition will be performed "as fast as possible", while the eccentric phase of the movement last approximately 1 to 2 seconds duration. Two minutes of rest between sets and exercises will be adopted.
